_header: O well of sweetness replete in every vein
Note:
A slightly different version occurs in The myracles of oure blessyd Lady, Westminster: Wynkyn de Worde, [1496] , no. 15, ed. Whiteford (1990)
XWhiteford, P. The Myracles of Oure Lady edited from Wynkyn de Worde’s edition.
Middle English Text 23. Heidelberg, 1990, 54.
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Legend of Dan Joos’, a miracle of the Virgin Mary — twenty stanzas rhyme royal

CamTCC601.First Lines:
o welle of swetnes replete in euery veyneThat all mankynde
                    preserued hast fro dethAnd all oure ioy fro langour dydest restreyneAt
                    thy natiuite o flowre of Nazareth…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…In honour of the that done thy psalmes redeAs was Dan Joos so
                    quyte hem for hyr mede

BLHar2251.First Lines:
O welle of swetnes replete in euery veyneThat almankynd preserued
                    hast fro deth…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…In honoure of the that these psalmes ReedeAs was dane Ioos so
                    quyte hem for his mede Amen
